skill.name: planning-guidelines
skill.description: Core planning principles for Portfolio Buddy 2 development. Use when: planning any feature implementation, modification, or refactoring. Ensures code preservation, mobile/desktop optimization, and thorough requirement gathering.
skill.summary: Core planning principles for Portfolio Buddy 2 development. Use when: planning any feature implement...
skill.author: 5MinFutures

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with no executable code, no network access, no file system operations, and no external dependencies. All code examples are purely illustrative documentation for Portfolio Buddy 2 development guidelines. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Apply Planning Guidelines for Portfolio Buddy
content.value_statement: Features for Portfolio Buddy 2 need careful planning to preserve existing code and work across mobile and desktop. This skill provides clear principles for code preservation, responsive design patterns, and decision frameworks that ensure consistent, maintainable development.
actual_capabilities: Guide code preservation decisions when adding features to Portfolio Buddy 2
Provide mobile and desktop responsive design patterns using Tailwind CSS
Structure clarifying questions with recommended options marked
Define risk assessment checklists before making code changes
Establish integration workflows with other Portfolio Buddy skills
limitations: Specific to Portfolio Buddy 2 codebase patterns and conventions
Does not execute code or access project files directly
Requires loading alongside architecture-reference for full context

use_cases.title: Add New Features
use_cases.description: Extend Portfolio Buddy 2 with new features while preserving existing code patterns and conventions

use_cases.title: Implement Responsive UI
use_cases.description: Add or modify UI components that work correctly on both mobile and desktop viewports

use_cases.title: Review Code Changes
use_cases.description: Evaluate proposed changes against established principles for risk and complexity

prompt_templates.title: Add New Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use planning-guidelines to add a new feature to Portfolio Buddy 2. Apply code preservation principles and ask clarifying questions before implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Create Responsive Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a responsive component using Tailwind patterns from planning-guidelines. Verify mobile and desktop layouts work correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate Code Change
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this proposed change using the risk assessment checklist from planning-guidelines. Is it low risk and easily reversible?

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the decision tree from planning-guidelines. Should we preserve existing code or propose improvements? What are the trade-offs?

output_examples.input: Add a chart settings panel to Portfolio Buddy 2
output: Preserve existing chart components - extend rather than replace
Use responsive patterns: stack on mobile, row on desktop
Ask clarifying questions about chart customization options needed
Follow existing component patterns from PortfolioSection.tsx
Check risk assessment: isolated change with easy rollback

output_examples.input: Fix a bug in the trading days calculation
output: Verify if code is actually broken or working as intended
Check if fix meets low-risk criteria (isolated, reversible)
Consider if bug fix qualifies for exception to preservation rule
Get user approval before implementing if not clear-cut

output_examples.input: Add a new input field for portfolio settings
output: Ask clarifying questions about required validation and defaults
Use existing useState patterns from similar components
Apply responsive spacing with gap-1 sm:gap-2 classes
Test touch targets meet 44px minimum on mobile
Preserve all existing functionality while extending

best_practices: Extend existing code before replacing it - preservation is the default behavior
Verify every feature works on both mobile (base Tailwind classes) and desktop (sm:, md: prefixes)
Ask clarifying questions with recommended options marked before starting ambiguous implementation tasks
anti_patterns: Refactoring working code without clear justification or explicit user approval
Adding features without testing responsive layouts on both mobile and desktop viewports
Guessing at requirements instead of asking clarifying questions when context is unclear

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for planning and implementing features.

faq.question: What types of changes have low risk?
faq.answer: Isolated changes to single functions, easily reversible modifications, no ripple effects on other features.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other Portfolio Buddy skills?
faq.answer: Load it first for principles, then use planning-framework for algorithms, coding-standards for implementation.

faq.question: Is user data handled safely?
faq.answer: This skill contains only documentation - no code executes, no files are accessed, no data is transmitted.

faq.question: What if the risk assessment fails?
faq.answer: If risk criteria are not met, preserve existing code and ask the user for guidance before proceeding.

faq.question: How does this differ from planning-framework?
faq.answer: Planning-guidelines provides core principles and patterns; planning-framework offers specific algorithms like Musk's 5-step method.
